task.title: Purchasing a Subscription in the Community Portal
task.abstract:
Direct Debit enabled subscriptions may be purchased by both authenticated and unauthenticated users in the Community Portal.
Known Issues
Abandoned Sales Orders
If the payment processor agency is offline for any reason, then the customer will be asked to return at a later time to create their agreement. However, since the Direct Debit Sales Order is in a Closed state, the online customer cannot access it and must start a new purchase.
Another source of abandoned transactions occurs when Direct Debit is selected by the customer as the form of payment, a new sales order is created. If there are no additional items in the cart, the original sales order is abandoned. These records will need to be manually deleted.

taskbody.prereq:
In order for customers to select Direct Debit as a payment method, System Admins must enable Direct Debit on the related Store. The Business Group identified on the Store record must have a Direct Debit Setting saved. Direct Debit enabled items can be purchased from a Store that is not Direct Debit enabled, however the customer will not be able to create a Direct Debit Agreement.
Additionally, Direct Debit items must be added to a Catalog in order to be added to the customerâ€™s cart. Only items that are Direct Debit enabled can be purchased with the Direct Debit payment option.

step.cmd: Log in to the Community Portal and navigate to the Store.
Add the Subscription Item to the Shopping Cart and select the desired Subscription Plan. Proceed to Checkout.
Click the Direct Debit payment method tab and then click the Setup Direct Debit button.
step.info: If there are multiple items in the Shopping Cart, then the items will sort into separate Sales Orders. A separate Sales Order is created for each Direct Debit enabled subscription plan based on the frequency and duration. Any items not Direct Debit enabled will remain in the original Sales Order to be purchased separately.

step.cmd: Check the I wish to set up Direct Debit checkbox and click Continue.
step.info: The displayed information complies with the legal requirements in the United Kingdom. The contact information (phone number and email address) is pulled from the Business Group related to the Store.

substep.cmd: After clicking Continue, the Amount of each payment will match the related Sales Order Line.
The Frequency is determined by the Subscription Plan.
The Term is the expected number of payments within the term of the subscription: 1 - Annually, 4 - Quarterly, 12 - Monthly.

step.cmd: Populate any required fields and click Continue.
step.info: The Email Address is required for all Direct Debit Agreement customers. After clicking Continue, the Account Number and Bank Sort Code are validated.

substep.cmd: Preview or Print the Acknowledgment page

taskbody.result: The customer has successfully purchased a Direct Debit enabled subscription in the Community Portal.
